metadata.title: Convert Rankine to Celsius – Temperature Converter
metadata.description: Convert temperature from Rankine (°R) to Celsius (°C), for interpreting engineering thermodynamics calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms temperature from Rankine to Celsius, enabling interpretation of thermodynamic calculations in familiar scales.
Rankine is an absolute temperature scale using Fahrenheit degree intervals, while Celsius is the everyday temperature scale.
This converter uses the relationship where °C = (°R / 1.8) - 273.15.
methodology: Rankine is an absolute scale where 0°R = absolute zero = -273.15°C. All Rankine temperatures are positive.
To convert Rankine to Celsius: °C = (°R / 1.8) - 273.15. This reverses the Celsius-to-Rankine process.
Engineering texts may use Rankine for thermodynamic properties while reporting final answers in Celsius.
This converter provides precise temperature conversions for engineering and scientific applications.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Rankine to Celsius?
Is Rankine the same as Kelvin?
faqs.answer: No. Both are absolute scales, but Rankine uses Fahrenheit-sized degrees while Kelvin uses Celsius-sized degrees. 1 K difference = 1.8°R difference.

faqs.question: When would I use Rankine?
faqs.answer: American engineers often use Rankine in thermodynamics. Most scientific work uses Kelvin instead.

glossary.definition: Absolute temperature scale using Fahrenheit degree intervals.
Temperature scale where water freezes at 0° and boils at 100°.
